group_1.narration: The Rumor of the Endless Solitude, the Rumor of the Invisible Girl...@When I heard those Rumors,@I couldn't think of it as someone else's problem.
Because, it's just like my old school days@when it never mattered if I was there or not.
Up until now, I would have just been heartbroken@upon hearing that Rumor,
but I think somewhere around this time I was wondering@if there was anything I could do to help.
After hearing the rumors from Rena,@I started getting a lot of emails.
When I looked into it with Yachiyo and the others,@it was an email from "Ai", the Rumor of the Endless Solitude.
The content of those emails was that she wanted@the [textBlue:Rumor] to be erased so that Sana Futaba could be saved.
But to save Sana,@only one person alone can go into the Endless Solitude.
Maybe it would've been better if someone else had gone@rather than my weak self,
But I wanted to help Sana, who is somewhat like me,@by myself.
I'm sure that the reason I've come to think that way@is also because
I've learned to express my own opinions@through time spent with everyone.
It may be that@Sana feels happy here,
Because Ai entrusted me with this,@I was determined to create a place where Sana would belong,@just like the one I found at Mikazuki Villa...
And in that new place, we hope to be able to convey@the love for Sana that Ai entrusted to us,
So after parting ways with Ai,@Sana eventually moved in with us at Mikazuki Villa.
In the beginning she seemed confused, and I was worried@that I wouldn't be able to provide a place for her.
Through buying matching mugs, and spending time together,@we gradually became a family, little by little.
As we were getting used to each other,@we decided to give Yachiyo matching coasters as a present.
For she's always helping us out,@and we wanted to return the favor.
...But in the end, we didn't manage to give it to her.
Because Mifuyu of the Wings of Magius@suddenly came to Mikazuki Villa to invite us@to attend a lecture by the Magius...
Because Yachiyo started to intentionally keep us away.
And then, that lecture tore our Mikazuki Villa...
...It tore our family to shreds.
